posts.title: In defense of IE6
posts.words: in defense of ie6 posted on 10 august 2009 and tagged with development discussions observations no really! read that title again i'm about to argue against placing so much blame for painful web at the door internet explorer 6 not going try claim isn't a huge pain arse all good developers let's face it love bitch but i do think it's time some accountability problem is simple has poor support standards doesn't always correctly render valid html css requires nudging tweaking finagling order display content desired way its interpretation javascript interactions dom are also less than perfect that's does really warrant such massive hatred from developers? as developer my first instinct would be answer 'well yes' cost developing extraordinarily high even when compared benefit market share because horrible consuming slog hang moment something meritocracy people tend vote their feet (or mice) will abandon weak experience favor strong this concept stretch browser too? surely if was bad have abandoned adopted better newer more well behaved right? yes many done exactly they upgraded ie7 ie8 firefox safari opera chrome or else honest hard find these days quite everyone who uses understands what just know click an icon get (by which often mean google) directly email one based services) understanding could choose different application accesses hese services perform tasks cognitive leap others realised use home computers work locked using whatever company department dictates means why that? posts.title: Unobtrusify your Javascript
posts.words: unobtrusify your javascript posted on 05 january 2009 and tagged with jquery development recently jon lister a colleague of mine at osmosoft showed me website made by his friend joshua bradley the site used some javscript code from tiddlywiki's animation engine to create nice visual effects i loved design but could see room for improvement in implementation i'm big advocate unobtrusive progressive enhancement so set about producing quick demo how similar result be achieved most web-kind accessible way available using behaviors has been published as unobtrusifycom aim effect that josh's make sure page is readable without use images headings look snazzy they are not required order content sense only keep html clean possible reduce number http requests few improve performance approach first all wrote text chose simple statement tried structure it such would regardless which sections were expanded then simplest markup logically represent its various this text-only browsers search engines web-crawlers screen-readers well-known css technique replace ensure remain non-human consumers while presented those able appreciate them you prevent browser scrolling element overflow:hidden scoot out text-indent now clear can display an image background-image specify dimensions desired property will resize correct size automatically something like this: #myheading { text-indent: -9999px; overflow: hidden; background-image: url(myimagegif); width: 380px; height: 123px; } my had 6 render also wanted have mouseover give affordance click-ability require another rather than having 12 download (which separate requests) combined these into single firstly combining one meant total bit smaller due file was compressed (a tiny saving every little helps) secondly there overhead making when comes fewer better method cuts 11 score! thirdly uses same original heading their associated no need preload alternate avoid nasty pause mousing over already downloaded ready bonus 'image sprite' each just needed background-position attributes common save h1 url(images/unobtrusive_spritegif); h1#uj background-position: 0 0; h1#cmh -123px; 150px; point our looks exactly we want things appear ability toggle shown full behavior suggest clicked (since cannot) essence perfectly serviceable web (albeit one) enhance enabled easily unobtrusively add elements hide do $('#wrapper > div')hide(); hides div direct descendent id wrapper (my chosen structure) default clickable clicking changing cursor h1')addclass('clickable'); class 'clickable' specifies cursor: pointer; show hover repositioning background mouse hidden click remember none happen unless additional trick flash unstyled or fouc (gratifyingly pronounced 'fooooook' john hicks) being very well explained karl swedberg excellent learningjquerycom picture what going why swing exercise right citizen view source hitting often best learn done go on! posts.title: Get your Task Management wiki
posts.words: get your task management wiki posted on 16 july 2008 and tagged with tiddlywiki javascript osmosoft after a bit of hiatus i've recently been concentrating developing my pet project teamtasks again is simple application built using t this little by no means new i have tinkering it for quite while but working other projects so has had to sit patiently in the corner wait me back rather gratifyingly few people seen early work expressed interest all manor purposes attention made realise that was time promote from its place playground (version 03 can still be found there those keen glancing rear view mirror) big time! or at least own getteamtaskscom born you download latest version (v04 writing) configure fit habits an open source i'm doing best resist urge tinker until think it's perfect before letting out into wild may find things about don't perfectly just like if that's case then please let know better yet fix show living old release often mantra here welcome contributions form suggestions bug reports fixes enhancements criticism praise sticky buns pats hugs along site way touch keep track developments obviously leave comments now also follow twitter you'd hear followed too course subject random utterances hours launching already nice response really helps motivated as gains momentum more pairs hands do we've spent some today planning next set which will soon listed inspect roll 05!

posts.title: NBA updates on Twitter
posts.words: nba updates on twitter posted 19 may 2008 and tagged with mashups python projects just in time for the playoffs heavily influenced by robbie clutton's marvellous uk football scores service i have created results this simple monitors published as rss feeds from totallyscores then sends to following you can get alerts of all match only interested your team? that's fine choose instead follow team there are currently accounts for: http://twittercom/celtics_results http://twittercom/cavs_results http://twittercom/hornets_results http://twittercom/jazz_results http://twittercom/lakers_results http://twittercom/magic_results http://twittercom/pistons_results http://twittercom/spurs_results i'll be adding more teams ready next season but if want make sure that team's feel free email me (phawksworth [at] gmail [dot] com) push top my todo list i'm also readying mlb provide major league baseball will active very soon please poke create their account code which drives is first outing into world find here take it use wish welcome feedback suggestions gentle though said playing many thanks nice folks at carsonified permission site's background image balakov who used each icon under a creative commons license flickr

posts.title: JSSpec bundle for Textmate helps with writing tests
posts.words: along the way we examined several javascript testing frameworks and found that jsspec suited our needs quite nicely resembles popular rspec framework popularly used by ruby developers as a result i have been dabbling away at writing tests in my favoured text editor - rather lovely textmate since this is repetitive task figured it was worth creating some helper to speed things offers an easy make powerful bundles automate tasks help you your code development so quickly put together bundle simple set of snippets which can act quick reference what methods are available let rapidly create test users download just double-click for use won't go into workings with here learn about official site feel free take modify fit purpose enjoy

posts.title: Observing Twitter behaviours
posts.words: observing twitter behaviours posted on 07 january 2008 and tagged with observations it seems that the twitterverse is all of a flutter following recent blog posts from phillie casablanca paul downey i'm watching this keen interest has been subject much impassioned discussion in our office frustrated by noisy habits some twitterers phil opened good practices led to him posting 10 commandments an attempt articulate highlight annoying when tweets for record right behind was quick follow interesting though observe response his post see how many people agree strongly object suggestions being told they should use that's fair enough isn't any one person dictate we rather patterns usage will emerge find own ways using get most out reasonable express think best value can be derived describe useful guidelines either adopt or not as wish my eyes what doing i also first admit word 'commandment' may bit strong but used elicit job done! sharing similar frustrations took things step further describing two different camps users: twits twerps judging responses are upset at labelled twit twerp thinking terms little (paul clarified recently tweet) personally merely playful am who sometimes displays twerpish tendencies(!) worry do have articulated jp rangaswami better than likely here experience newbie avoid creating environment which intimidating unwelcoming new user emerging nanoformats add great must never try instead provide complete accessible information them anyone interested scared off irc like years seemingly ferocious users knew conventions inside didn't appear tolerate newcomers i'd hate end up tips iron rod force 'our way' photo credit: mike hoff

posts.title: Osmosoft return from LeWeb3 intact
posts.words: osmosoft return from leweb3 intact posted on 17 december 2007 and tagged with news events tools last week the entire team visited paris to attend conference initially we had intended be attending simply as delegates but time went by decided that might able build something handy use at perhaps others find it useful too so ripperap (then dubbed 'tiddleleweb') was conceived considered building a tool based tiddlywiki where you could make notes effortlessly share those while being shielded network hiccups would cool ready much do little found getting up-to-date accurate information about agenda website fiddly including an using basic navigation in ripplerap seemed like natural choice for added value also used microformats markup export sessions your calendar since were planning hand out copies of other have stand explain what doing open source world bt shared which busy throughout i think having paul downey around talk people through his excellent popular uber-doodle 'the web is agreement' (more than 60 thousand views flickr writing) helped draw rather retro-chic bat phone raised smile enabled every copy free calls order get support feature made easy mojo bt's rest exposure its 21csdk distributed mantra 'release early release often' ringing our ears there no arguing suggestion this application it's days releasing software way has been revelation me i'm more traditional cycle possessively guard work until are good face scrutiny conferences hear regularly always met lots enthusiastic head nodding room lot feedback finding all valuable hopefully next will some improvements suggested whole pretty speakers really interesting unexpected gems yossi vardi philippe starck entertaining although gather these talks already available youtube listening jp rangaswami ever inspiring lucky enough listen several ad hoc discussions noted rarely saw talking without small crowd gathering him unexpectedly myself stage am now enjoying glory photos described takes le supported phil hawksworth brilliant! posts.title: Opening a Finder window from the Terminal
posts.words: opening a finder window from the terminal posted on 04 november 2007 and tagged with osx tips i stumbled upon simple method for at your current session location recently since it is something that have regular need thought there might be other mac users out who also find this useful time to set things up so easy use whenever you just follow these two steps: first using preferred text editor create file which contains command: !/bin/bash open /system/library/coreservices/finderapp $pwd should name whatever want call later named fndr second place somewhere visible path collect any little utility scripts like together in directory called utils added my make all of its contents easily accessible now can simply type present if help adding recommend creating home (it may even already exist) bash_profile gets invoked enter environment add an item by entering line file: export path='$path:/users/philh/utils' i'm always look bits pieces life easier not think are difficult excellent os but room shortcuts speed common tasks gems world would great could post them comments thanks! update: done single command as turns this:
